ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Do you avoid visiting the final place of rest (gravesite, urn, etc.) or memorial site?
Do you avoid places associated with the death? (for example, hospitals, funeral homes or other places that remind you of the death)
Do you avoid looking at photographs of the person who died?
Do you find yourself trying not to think about the person who died?
Do you avoid talking about the person who died with family members or friends?
Do you avoid contact with personal belongings of the person who died?
Do you avoid rooms or places that you associate with the person who died?
Do you avoid activities around your home that are associated with the person who died?
Do you avoid activities outside your home associated with the person who died?
Do you avoid activities with family members that are associated with the person who died?
Do you avoid social activities with friends that are associated with the person who died?
Do you avoid social activities with couples or other groups that provoke feelings of being ''odd man out'' or feelings of intense longing for the person who died?
Do you avoid going to funerals?
Do you avoid visiting with ill people?
Do you avoid talking to others about painful losses?
Grief-Related Avoidance Questionnaire Total Score
